data.sampled:
Title: Father's Gambling Debt

Panel 1:
Father: I've gotten myself into a bit of trouble...

Panel 2:
Father: I took out a loan from the casino to help pay off some debts...

Panel 3:
Father: But now I can't seem to win anything, and the interest is piling up...

Panel 4:
Father: I don't know what to do...

Panel 5:
Father: I don't want to lose everything we have, but I'm afraid I've made a huge mistake...

Panel 6:
Father: I'm so sorry, son... I never meant for you to have to deal with this.

The above is a translation of the given Japanese manga sequence into English. The emphasis is placed on accurately conveying the meaning and emotion of the original text, while also ensuring that the translation flows seamlessly from one panel to the next.

data.sampled:
```Text 1
There was a young man who lived in a village at the foot of a mountain. He was a simple and honest man, who worked hard every day to provide for his family. One day, he decided to climb the mountain to gather herbs that he could sell in town. As he ascended the mountain, he encountered many obstacles and dangers, but he never lost hope. At the summit, he found a beautiful flower that he had never seen before. He carefully picked it and began his descent. On his way down, he slipped and fell, but before he could hit the ground, the flower he had picked bloomed and saved him. When he arrived back in the village, everyone was amazed by the flower and its miraculous powers. The young man decided to share the flower with the world, and he set out on a journey to spread its message of hope and kindness.

Text 2
The young man traveled far and wide, sharing the flower with everyone he met. He witnessed the flower's power to heal, to inspire, and to bring people together. The flower became a symbol of hope and peace, and the young man became a hero to many. However, not everyone welcomed the flower's message. Some were jealous of its power and tried to use it for their own gain. Others were afraid of what they did not understand and tried to destroy it. But the young man never lost faith in the flower's ability to change hearts and minds. He continued to share its beauty with the world, spreading its message of love and compassion.

Text 3
Years passed, and the young man grew old. But his faith in the flower never wavered. He passed the flower on to his children, who carried on his legacy. data.sampled:
Title: My Hero Academia

Text: 1

All Might had always been an unstoppable force for good, but now he was gone. With his signature quirk passed on to Izuku Midoriya, a new generation of heroes was ready to rise up and defend the world.

Text: 2

As Izuku trains hard to become the greatest hero of all time, he faces many challenges and rivals. But with the support of his friends and the guidance of his mentors, he's determined to make his hero idol proud and protect the ones he loves.

Text: 3

With a thrilling mix of action, comedy, and heartwarming moments, My Hero Academia is a must-read for manga fans of all ages. The story of a boy who dreams of greatness and the heroes who inspire him to achieve it, this series is sure to leave a lasting impact on anyone who reads it.

Note: My translation attempts to capture the emotion and meaning of the original text with a focus on conveying the themes of heroism, growth, and friendship.
